citation.article-title: Pibocella ponti gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from the green alga Acrosiphonia sonderi
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pibocella [Pi.bo.cel′la. N.L. fem. n. Pibocella arbitrary name, derived from the acronym PIBOC (Pacific Institute of Bioorganic Chemistry, FEB RAS), where the type species was first isolated and examined].
Cytochrome oxidase-, catalase- and alkaline phosphatase-positive.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-6.

The main cellular fatty acids are straight-chain unsaturated and branched-chain unsaturated fatty acids i-15 : 0, a-15 : 0, i-15 : 1, i-16 : 1, i-16 : 0, i-16 : 0 3-OH, i-17 : 1ω9c, i-17 : 0 3-OH and summed feature 3, consisting of i15 : 0 2-OH and/or 16 : 1ω7c.
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Pibocella is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae.
The type species is Pibocella ponti.
